DESCRIPTION: The number of characters in the variable data section.  The total record length = 105 + the value stored in this field.
DOM: A general domain comprised of the characters in the ASCII character set.

LONG_NAME: FIXED-WEATHER-STATION USAF MASTER STATION CATALOG identifier
DESCRIPTION: The identifier that represents a FIXED-WEATHER-STATION.
DOM: A general domain comprised of the characters in the ASCII character set. This field includes all surface reporting stations, including ships, buoys, etc.

DESCRIPTION: The identifier that represents a FIXED-WEATHER-STATION.
DOM: A general domain comprised of the characters in the ASCII character set.

DESCRIPTION: The date of a GEOPHYSICAL-POINT-OBSERVATION.
DOM: A general domain comprised of integer values 0-9 in the format YYYYMMDD. YYYY can be any positive integer value; MM is restricted to values 01-12; and DD is restricted to values 01-31.

DESCRIPTION: The time of a GEOPHYSICAL-POINT-OBSERVATION based on
DOM: A general domain comprised of integer values 0-9 in the format HHMM. HH is restricted to values 00-23; MM is restricted to values 00-59.

DESCRIPTION: The flag of a GEOPHYSICAL-POINT-OBSERVATION showing the source or combination of sources used in creating the observation.
DOM: A general domain comprised of values 1-9 and A-N.

DESCRIPTION: The latitude coordinate of a GEOPHYSICAL-POINT-OBSERVATION where southern hemisphere is negative.
DOM: A general domain comprised of the numeric characters (0-9), a plus sign (+), and a minus sign (-). +99999 = Missing

DESCRIPTION: The longitude coordinate of a GEOPHYSICAL-POINT-OBSERVATION where values west from 000000 to 179999 are signed negative.
DOM: A general domain comprised of the numeric characters (0-9), a plus sign (+), and a minus sign (-). +999999 = Missing

DESCRIPTION: The code that denotes the type of geophysical surface observation.
DOM: A specific domain comprised of the characters in the ASCII character set.

DESCRIPTION: The elevation of a GEOPHYSICAL-POINT-OBSERVATION relative to Mean Sea Level (MSL).
DOM: A general domain comprised of the numeric characters (0?9), a minus sign ( ), and a plus sign (+). +9999 = Missing

DESCRIPTION: The identifier that represents the call letters assigned to a FIXED?WEATHER?STATION.
DOM: A general domain comprised of the characters in the ASCII character set. 99999 = Missing.

DESCRIPTION: The name of the quality control process applied to a weather observation.
DOM: A general domain comprised of the ASCII character set.

DESCRIPTION: The angle, measured in a clockwise direction, between true north and the direction from which the wind is blowing.
DOM: A general domain comprised of the numeric characters (0?9). 999 = Missing.  If type code (below) = V, then 999 indicates variable wind direction.

DESCRIPTION: The code that denotes a quality status of a reported WIND-OBSERVATION direction angle.
DOM: A specific domain comprised of the characters in the ASCII character set.

DESCRIPTION: The code that denotes the character of the WIND-OBSERVATION.
DOM: A specific domain comprised of the characters in the ASCII character set. NOTE:  If a value of 9 appears with a wind speed of 0000, this indicates calm winds.

DESCRIPTION: The rate of horizontal travel of air past a fixed point.
DOM: A general domain comprised of the numeric characters (0?9). 9999 = Missing.

DESCRIPTION: The code that denotes a quality status of a reported WIND-OBSERVATION speed rate.
DOM: A specific domain comprised of the characters in the ASCII character set.

DESCRIPTION: The height above ground level (AGL) of the lowest cloud or obscuring phenomena layer aloft with 5/8 or more summation total sky cover, which may be predominantly opaque, or the vertical visibility into a surface based obstruction.  Unlimited = 22000.
DOM: A general domain comprised of the numeric characters (0?9). 99999 = Missing.

DESCRIPTION: The code that denotes a quality status of a reported ceiling height dimension.
DOM: A specific domain comprised of the characters in the ASCII character set.

DESCRIPTION: The code that denotes the method used to determine the ceiling.
DOM: A specific domain comprised of the characters in the ASCII character set.

DESCRIPTION: The code that represents whether the 'Ceiling And Visibility Okay' (CAVOK) condition has been
DOM: A specific domain comprised of the characters in the ASCII character set.

DESCRIPTION: The horizontal distance at which an object can be seen and identified.
DOM: A specific domain comprised of the characters in the ASCII character set. Missing = 999999. NOTE:  Values greater than 160000 are entered as 160000

DESCRIPTION: The code that denotes a quality status of a reported distance of a visibility observation.
DOM: A specific domain comprised of the characters in the ASCII character set.

DESCRIPTION: The code that denotes whether or not the reported visibility is variable.
DOM: A specific domain comprised of the characters in the ASCII character set.

DESCRIPTION: The code that denotes a quality status of a reported VISIBILITY-OBSERVATION variability code.
DOM: A specific domain comprised of the characters in the ASCII character set.

DESCRIPTION: The temperature of the air.
DOM: A general domain comprised of the numeric characters (0?9), a plus sign (+), and a minus sign (-). +9999 = Missing.

DESCRIPTION: The code that denotes a quality status of an AIR-TEMPERATURE-OBSERVATION.
DOM: A specific domain comprised of the characters in the ASCII character set.

DESCRIPTION: The temperature to which a given parcel of air must be cooled at constant pressure and water vapor content in order for saturation to occur.
DOM: A general domain comprised of the numeric characters (0?9), a plus sign (+), and a minus sign ( ). +9999 = Missing.

DESCRIPTION: The code that denotes a quality status of the reported dew point temperature.
DOM: A specific domain comprised of the characters in the ASCII character set.

DESCRIPTION: The air pressure relative to Mean Sea Level (MSL).
DOM: A general domain comprised of the numeric characters (0?9). 99999 = Missing.

LONG_NAME: ATMOSPHERIC-PRESSURE-OBSERVATION sea level pressure quality code
DESCRIPTION: The code that denotes a quality status of the sea level pressure of an ATMOSPHERIC-PRESSURE-OBSERVATION.
DOM: A specific domain comprised of the characters in the ASCII character set.
